result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathaniel Jerome Flemming

records.addlTxt: Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Nathaniel Jerome Flemming not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted appeared by video for Nathaniel Jerome Flemming.  Attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Plummer is now the attorney of record.  Defense enters a speedy trial demand.
Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 11-10-22 at 10:00 am for final pretrial and 11-16-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nathaniel Jerome Flemming not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status of counsel.  No attorney has been appointed yet.  Court ordered case adjourned for an Order To Show Cause as to why an attorney has not been appointed yet.  Case is adjourned to 10-11-22 at 1;30 pm for an Order to Show Cause hearing. 
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Order to show cause hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nathaniel Jerome Flemming not in court.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Pretrial Conference.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel on this case.  Court will adjourn case for status of counsel.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with W.B.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered an oral no contact order with W.Y.B.  State to submit a written no contact order on the next court date.

Defendant Nathaniel Jerome Flemming in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Nathaniel Jerome Flemming in custody.  Sarah Mackenzie Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant WITHELD plea.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
